instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2337: What is A2337? A2337 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2020 M1 with EMC 3598, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02016..

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> going into restore mode
threads.message:
Hello, I have a MacBook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that came into my shop for a screen replacement. 
I did order a brand new screen and installed it when arrived.
After this, I turned on the MacBook, booted to the login screen, and that was all.
Then I closed the back lid and tried to turn it back on again, but it went into restore mode, and I couldn't do anything.

I tried to :
Revive the system but is not working at all.
Is anyone having any idea about what it could be?

I replaced plenty of screens, but I never issued this problem.

Any help would be much appreciated.
